result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:21 AM Defendant Crystal G Mendoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson appeared by video for Crystal G Mendoza.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

1:15 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Crystal G Mendoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Crystal G Mendoza. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with the retail establishment/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:52 PM Defendant Crystal G Mendoza in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Crystal G Mendoza. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Public Defenders office to evaluate defendant prior to next date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
